title: AIRBAG ARRANGEMENT
abstract: The invention relates to an airbag arrangement for a vehicle passenger restraint system, having an airbag (1) and at least one first and one second inflatable chamber (11, 12) of the airbag, wherein the first chamber (11) has at least one section designed as an exhaust area (112) via which air can escape from the first chamber (11), and wherein the exhaust area (112) is arranged relative to the second chamber (12) in such a way that the exhaust area (112) is pressed together by the action of the interior pressure (P2) of the second chamber (12) if the interior pressure (P2) of the second chamber (12) is higher than the interior pressure (P1) of the first chamber (11), and as a result the exhaust cross section of the exhaust area (112) is reduced.

motivations: There is a need for improved airbag arrangements in vehicle passenger restraint systems to enhance safety and performance.
objectives: Design an airbag arrangement with inflatable chambers that can regulate air escape based on internal pressure differences.
methods: Create an airbag with at least two inflatable chambers, one of which has an exhaust area for air escape.
Position the exhaust area so that it is compressed by the internal pressure of the second chamber when its pressure exceeds that of the first chamber.
results: Reduce the exhaust cross-section of the exhaust area when the internal pressure of the second chamber is higher, thereby controlling air escape.
llama_json.research_subject: Airbag arrangement for vehicle passenger restraint systems with pressure-regulated exhaust

motivations: There is a need for improved airbag arrangements in vehicle passenger restraint systems to enhance safety.
objectives: Design an airbag arrangement with at least two inflatable chambers, where one chamber has an exhaust area for air to escape.
Ensure the exhaust area is arranged in such a way that its cross section is reduced when the interior pressure of the second chamber is higher than the first, thereby controlling air escape.
methods: Design an airbag with at least two inflatable chambers, one of which has an exhaust area for air escape.
Arrange the exhaust area relative to the second chamber such that the exhaust cross section is reduced when the interior pressure of the second chamber is higher.
results: The proposed airbag arrangement allows for controlled air escape, potentially enhancing the safety of vehicle passenger restraint systems.
openai_json.research_subject: Improved airbag arrangement for vehicle passenger restraint systems

motivations: Conventional airbag systems require improved control over pressure regulation and deflation characteristics to enhance passenger safety during vehicle collisions.
objectives: Develop an airbag arrangement with multiple chambers that can automatically regulate exhaust flow based on differential pressure between chambers.
methods: Design an airbag with at least two inflatable chambers where the first chamber includes an exhaust area positioned to be compressed by the second chamber's pressure.
Utilize pressure differential between chambers to control the exhaust cross-section, enabling automatic regulation of air escape.
results: The airbag arrangement provides adaptive pressure regulation through automatic adjustment of the exhaust area based on inter-chamber pressure differences.
Enhanced passenger safety through controlled deflation characteristics that respond to deployment conditions.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Multi-chamber airbag arrangement with pressure-regulated exhaust system
